ch.aplu.robotsim

Class UltrasonicSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Actor
      • ch.aplu.robotsim.Part
        • ch.aplu.robotsim.UltrasonicSensor

  • public class UltrasonicSensor
extends Part
    Class that represents a ultrasonic sensor. The sensor detects targets in a cone with the apex at the current LegoRobot location. The cone's axis orientation may be selected using the port parameter (forward, left or backward direction of the current LegoRobot direction). The beam opening angle (beam width) is fixed to the value ultrasonicBeamWidth defined in ShareConstants.java. Targets normally have a visible actor sprite image, but the target detection algorithms does not use it. The detection is based on a mesh of triangles defined when the target is created.

    Targets may dynamically change (modification of their location, new targets added, existing targets removed) because the current target layout is used each time the getDistance() method is called.

    Only one ultrasonic sensor is supported.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UltrasonicSensor(SensorPort port)
      The port selection determines the position of the sensor and the direction of the beam axis.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UltrasonicSensor

        public UltrasonicSensor(SensorPort port)
        The port selection determines the position of the sensor and the direction of the beam axis. S1: forward; S2: left, S3: backward. Creates a sensor instance connected to the given port. Only one sensor is allowed.
        Parameters:
        port - the port where the sensor is plugged-in

    • Method Detail

      • addUltrasonicListener

        public void addUltrasonicListener(UltrasonicListener listener,
                                  int triggerLevel)
        Registers the given UltrasonicListener to detect crossing the given trigger triggerLevel.
        Parameters:
        listener - the UltrasonicListener to register
        triggerLevel - the distance value used as trigger level

      • addUltrasonicListener

        public void addUltrasonicListener(UltrasonicListener listener)
        Registers the given UltrasonicListener with default trigger triggerLevel 100.
        Parameters:
        listener - the UltrasonicListener to register

      • setTriggerLevel

        public int setTriggerLevel(int triggerLevel)
        Sets a new trigger level and returns the previous one.
        Parameters:
        triggerLevel - the new trigger level
        Returns:
        the previous trigger level

      • getDistance

        public int getDistance()
        Returns the distance to the nearest target object. The distance must be adapted to the real robot's environment (the real ultrasonic sensor returns distances in cm in the range 0..255 (255 corresponds to no target detected).
        Returns:
        the distance (in pixels of the 501x501 pixel window); -1 of no target in range or robot inside a target

      • getPort

        public SensorPort getPort()
        Returns the port of the sensor.
        Returns:
        the sensor port

      • setMeshTriangleColor

        public void setMeshTriangleColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color of the triangle mesh lines.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the mesh; if null, the mesh is not shown (default)

      • setBeamAreaColor

        public void setBeamAreaColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color of the beam area (two sector border lines and axis).
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the beam area; if null, the beam lines are not shown (default)

      • eraseBeamArea

        public void eraseBeamArea()
        Erases the beam area (if it is currently shown).

      • setProximityCircleColor

        public void setProximityCircleColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color of the circle with center at sensor location and radius equals to the current distance value. If value = 0, no circle is shown.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the circle; if null, the circle is not shown (default)
